intro: Pholidia veronica, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its showy, blue to purple flower heads. The plant produces small, white to yellow flowers that bloom in clusters, creating a mist-like appearance. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators. Pholidia veronica prefers moist, well-drained soils and partial to full sunlight.
